title: Quiz  - SchemesTap 1st to 15th October 2022
instruction: NEP 2020 has emphasized on the empowerment of the young minds and creating a learning ecosystem that can make the young readers/learners ready for leadership roles in the future world. India tops the chart in youth population being 66% of the total, waiting to be tapped for capacity building and thereby nation building. With the purpose of mentoring a new generation of young creative writers, there is an imminent requirement to take initiatives at highest level, and in this context, YUVA 2.0 scheme has been launched and is expected to go a long way in laying the foundation of the future leaders of the creative world.

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to the scheme mentioned in paragraph?

A. Age limit for the scheme is 17.5 to 23 years.

B. An income tax exempted SevaNidhi Package, equal to Rs. 11.71 lakh to be provided on exit.

C. Non-contributory Life Insurance Cover of Rs. 48 lakh to be provided during the engagement period.

D. Up to 25% of each batch of Agniveers will be enrolled in regular cadre of the Armed Forces.
options: Only A
Only B
Only C
Only D
None of the above

quiz.text:
The above scheme provides for one-time Ex-gratia based on percentage disability laid down by medical authorities. Which of the following is not correctly matched in this regard?

 

% Disability

Compensation

A

50%

Rs. 15 lakh

B

75%

Rs. 29 lakh

C

100%

options: A and B
A and C
Only A
Only B

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement is/are correct with respect to above scheme?

A. Monthly pay equal to Rs. 40,000 will be provided during 4th year of service.

B. 10% of monthly pay to be deducted towards contribution to ‘Agniveer Corpus’.

C. Ex-gratia of Rs. 44 lakh in case of death attributable to service.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following are the major initiatives taken under Atal Innovation Mission (AIM)?

A. Atal Tinkering Labs

B. Atal Incubation Centers

C. Atal New India Challenges

D. Mentor India Campaign
options: A, B, C
A, C, D
B, C, D
A, B, D
A, B, C, D

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to AIM?

A. Central government has approved continuation of Atal Innovation Mission till March 2023

B. Government has set a target of establishing 101 Atal Incubation Centres and 5000 Atal Tinkering Labs

C. Grant-in-aid of Rs. 10 Lakh is provided to each school establishing Atal Tinkering Labs
options: Only A
A and C
Only B
B and C
Only C

quiz.text:
Atal New India Challenge (ANIC) is a flagship program of Atal Innovation Mission to seek, select, support and nurture technology-based innovations that solve sectoral challenges of national importance and societal relevance.

Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to ANIC?

A. Any Indian company incorporated under the Companies Act 1956/2013 is eligible, preferably an MSME

B. ANIC solicits innovations in the prototype stage and supports the selected start-ups through to the commercialization stage over a course of 12 – 18 months

C. Funding of up to INR 5 crore is provided for each winner start-up / MSME
options: A and C
B and C
A and B
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:

quiz.text:
Under the scheme, the credit guarantee cover under the Scheme would be transaction based and umbrella based. Which one of the following is correct with respect to the extent of transaction-based cover?

A. 80% of the amount in default if the original loan sanction amount is up to Rs. 3 crore.

B. 90% of the amount in default if the original loan sanction amount is above Rs. 3 crore, and up to Rs. 5 crore.

C. 65% of the amount in default if the original loan sanction amount is above Rs. 5 crore.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C

None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following are the eligibility criteria for the National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship Scheme?

A.     Students whose parental income from all sources is not more than Rs. 5,50,000 per annum are eligible to avail the scholarships.

B.      The student must have minimum of 75% marks or equivalent grade in Class VII examination for appearing in selection test for award of scholarship (relaxable by 5% for SC and ST students).

C.      The student should be studying as regular student in a Government, Government-aided and local body schools.

D.     There is reservation as per State Government norms.
options: A, B and C
C and D
A, C and D
A and B
A, B, C and D

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to above scheme?

A. Scheme is available to persons in the age group 18 to 60 years with bank account

B. In case of multiple saving bank accounts held by an individual in one or different banks, person can join the scheme through one savings bank account only

C. The 1-year risk coverage is applicable from 1st June every year till 31st May next year.

D. Subscribers who wish to continue need to give their consent for auto-debit before each successive May 31st for successive years.
options: A, B and C
B and D
A, C and D
B, C and D
C and D

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect with respect to the above scheme?
options: The premium applicable under the scheme is Rs. 12 per annum
Risk coverage of Rs. 2 lakh for accidental death and permanent total disability
Risk coverage of Rs. 1 lakh for permanent partial disability
The accident cover of the member shall terminate on attaining age 70 years

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to PMSBY?

A. Insurance cover under PMSBY is above and over any other scheme subscribed by the beneficiary

B. Reimbursement of hospitalisation expenses up to Rs. 25,000 following the accident will be covered

C. Death or disability resulting from natural calamities, suicide and murder is not covered under the PMSBY

D. Participating Banks will be the Master policy holders

A and D
B and C
B and D
C and D

B. NRIs holding bank account with a bank branch located in India

C. Joint bank account holders

A. PMEGP is a Central Sector Scheme.

B. Maximum project cost for manufacturing sector is limited to Rs. 50 lakh

C. Units that are minimum 5 years old can avail the assistance under PMEGP

B. Co-operative Societies, SHG and Charitable Trusts
